noun.description: Edible starch which is obtained from a palm and is a staple food in parts of the tropics. The pith inside the trunk is scraped out, washed, and dried to produce a flour or processed to produce the granular sago used in the West.
The palm from which most sago is obtained, growing in freshwater swamps in Southeast Asia.

origin: Mid 16th century: from Malay sagu (originally via Portuguese).
